RECREATIONAL.summary: It is illegal for adults to possess cannabis in Idaho. State law prohibits possession of cannabis for any purpose, including recreational use by adults. Possession of three ounces or less is a misdemeanor with a mandatory minimum $300 fine and possible jail time; possession of more than three ounces is a felony. There are no exceptions for adult use, and Idaho has not enacted any legalization or decriminalization measures.
RECREATIONAL.gov_quote: Marijuana is a Schedule 1 controlled substance under the Controlled Substances Act and Idaho law. As such, the use and sale of marijuana for any purpose is illegal in Idaho. It is illegal for any person to manufacture, deliver, possess with intent to manufacture or deliver, or possess marijuana, which refers to all parts of the plants of the genus cannabis, including or any preparation of cannabis which contains tetrahydrocannabinol.
RECREATIONAL.validation_notes: Exact quote found verbatim on the official Idaho government page. The answer 'NO' is correct and fully supported by the cited source. No changes required.
